definitions.definition: to fail to do or experience something, often something planned or expected, or to avoid doing or experiencing something:
examples: I missed the start of the class because my bus was late.

definitions.definition: to arrive too late to get on a bus, train, or aircraft:
examples: You'll miss your flight if you don't hurry up.
Students who miss a lot of school can find it hard to catch up.

definitions.definition: to not see or hear something or someone:
examples: I missed the beginning of the show.

definitions.definition: to not notice someone or something:
examples: You don't miss much, do you? Nobody else noticed that mistake.

definitions.definition: an occasion when something or someone fails to hit something or avoids hitting something:
examples: Well done! You scored eight hits and only two misses.

definitions.definition: a title used before the family name or full name of a single woman who has no other title:
examples: Dr White will see you now, Miss Carter.

definitions.definition: used as a form of address for a girl or young woman:
examples: Excuse me, Miss, you dropped this.

definitions.definition: sometimes used by children to address or refer to teachers who are women:
examples: Can I go to the toilet, Miss?

definitions.definition: a title given to a woman who wins a beauty contest, combined with the name of the place that she represents:
